reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had stayed at the Marakesh the previous year and found it quite satisfactory - spacious and clean, albeit a little dated. On this new occassion we were very disappointed with the standard of maintenance and cleanliness. Furnishings and carpet were worn and stained. The extractor hood in the kitchen was clogged with foul-smelling grease. The matress protector on the large bed was stained and torn. The outlet blades on the AC unit were covered in mould, and the outside walls - onto which the bedroom looked, were filthy with spider webbing, mould and dirt.
reviews.title: Once bitten ..............

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we commented on this we were told the apartment could be cleaned for a fee. My email of complaint when we returned home received no reply.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

likes.liked: — Great pool facilities, beautiful views from balcony, great location
likes.disliked: — Internet access was on the more expensive side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I assume that this experience was indicative of the actual apartment owner's level of cleanliness, but it also reflects badly on the overall management.
reviews.title: Complete Delight, hotel bliss

likes.liked: — everything! so central to all shops, restaurants etc
likes.disliked: — nothing. Only thing it is an apartment so if you're staying only a few nights, your room isn't serviced. but who cares, i dont like having my room serviced anyway.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complex is well situated, being in a relatively quiet area and within easy walking distance of most local attractions, but following this experience we would never stay at the Marakesh again.
reviews.title: Booked to go back again

likes.disliked: — The Resturant/Bar - We took our own drinks and had them in the room or beside the pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the same time, it would appear from the reviews of more recent guests that there has been some form of re-furbishment
reviews.title: Disappointed with Marrekesh
Nice Hotel
reviews.text: This hotel (or apartments) are very elegant and sophisticated. The lobby is lovely and the pools and spas are inviting. The rooms are spacious and offer a lot more room than a hotel room.

reviews.title: Dont stay at Marakesh if you like good service
reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again for sure.
I stayed at the Marrakesh in October for 7 nights when I went up to QLD for a holiday with my boyfriend and 2 mates (another couple) for Indy.
reviews.title: Best Holiday Ever!!

likes.disliked: — That you can not go in the pool after 9 or 10pm ish.

reviews.text: We stayed in a 2 Bedroom Deluxe room which was great as there were two couples. So there were 2 bedrooms, one with a QB the other with a KB which was actually 2 singles put together but we hardly noticed it was so comfortable! We also had 2 bathrooms, a balcony with a nice view with 3 doors opening out onto it. One from each bedroom and one from the lounge room. It was awesome! We even had a laundry! All kitchen utensils and appliances that we needed! It was great!
reviews.title: Wonderful Place to Stay
I dont recomment the Marrakesh
reviews.text: I found the staff to be friendly and helpful everytime we dealt with them. Even on our last day there they helped us out with keeping our bags locked away in a back room as our checkout was in the morning but our flight home wasn't until 8.30pm. Also the bar there 'Kesh bar' was really nice. Nice food and lovely people. The gardens well kept and maintained. Pool/ Spa/Sauna areas were lovely and relaxing and BBQ/rooftop garden area was fantastic. We had a BBQ on the roof our 1st night there and the view of the night skyline was spectacular!!
The hotel is close to the beach, has a bus stop right out the front and is only a short 10 min walk either way to broadbeach or Surfers paradise (Cavil Ave.) It also has carpark space available.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place with lovely views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and i had an excellent 4 night stay at the Marrakech this September. The price we paid was very fair - much cheaper than similar standard apartments in the broadbeach area.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Marrakech

likes.disliked: — Check in shuts at 5:30 and you have to dial night manager to check in after 5:30

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a 1 bedroom apartment. It overlooked the pool - a seaview costs another $20 a night. The room was very well presented and quite large. Tv in longe and another in the bedroom. The bathroom was clean.
reviews.title: Spacious and a great location

reviews.text: We had lunch athe Kech restaurant - good value at $10 - $15. The pool area is very nice - heated in door and out door pools, spas anda sauna. The area though would become quite crowded in peak times.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay!

likes.liked: — The pool, the view, the kitchenette
likes.disliked: — The bed was as like concrete!!

reviews.title: Marrakesh Apartments are awesome
reviews.text: The Marrakech is a 10 - 15 minute walk to the Broadbeach Dining area and a little more into surfers. The beach though is only a short walk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also highly recommend the Pink Poodle for a belgium beer and musscles.
reviews.title: Overall? Pretty happy and a great rest.
